title: Document AI - Enrichment and normalization
abstract:
# Document AI - Enrichment and normalization
# Enrichment and normalization
Document AI uses [Enterprise Knowledge Graph](/enterprise-knowledge-graph/docs/overview) to normalize and enrich entity extraction results (for supported fields). For example, the addresses `123 Main St Apt 1` and `123 Main street # 1` could be normalized to the same standardized address.
For each supported field, Document AI also returns a [normalizedValue](/document-ai/docs/reference/rest/v1/Document#normalizedvalue) in addition to the raw extracted field. This will contain the data in a standardized format to reduce post processing.
Most will belong to one of the following categories:
- Money
- Date
- Timestamp
- Address
- Boolean
- Integer
- Float
content:
## Sample response
The enriched values can be found in the [entities.normalizedValue](/document-ai/docs/reference/rest/v1/Document#NormalizedValue) field as shown in the following truncated sample:
```
{  "entities": [    {      "textAnchor": {        "textSegments": [ ... ],        "content": "Google Singapore"      },      "type": "employer_name",      "mentionText": "Google Singapore",      "confidence": 0.69933707,      "pageAnchor": {        "pageRefs": [          {            "boundingPoly": {              "normalizedVertices": [ ... ]            }          }        ]      },      "id": "9",      "normalizedValue": {        "text": "Google Asia Pacific, Singapore"      }    }  ]}
```
In the sample, the original `employer_name` "Google Singapore" has been normalized to "Google Asia Pacific, Singapore".
In the Google Cloud console, the enriched and normalized fields are annotated with **G** . For example:
